events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred on April 30, resulting in visible damage to their car's front bumper and left headlight.
The claim was assigned to the Auto Accident category following the review of the initial accident description and reported damage.
Agent Michael Thompson was assigned to handle the customer's vehicle accident claim, ensuring direct communication and support.
The insurer sent an acknowledgment message to the customer confirming receipt of the car accident claim and next procedural steps.
Requested the customer to provide police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and insurance information within the next seven days.
Customer successfully submitted all requested documentation, including accident photos and police report via the online portal.
Investigation team commenced evaluation of the submitted evidence and began assessing liability for the vehicle collision.
The investigation concluded that the collision was caused by a third party, allowing for claim approval procedures to begin.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and rental car expenses during the repair period.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling of the claim and the proposed settlement terms.
Approval was granted to proceed with payment for the vehicle repairs, based on the settlement terms previously communicated.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer's repair shop in full according to the approved settlement agreement.
The vehicle accident claim has been officially closed following confirmation of repairs and payment completion.
All claim documents and communications were securely archived for future reference in accordance with company policy.
